Name: Carmencita
description:
Carmencita is skillful woman who has been dedicated to agriculture for 20 years. She lives in Suaza, Huila, where she owns a two-hectare farm that she bought 27 years ago. On her land, she cultivates over 7,000 coffee plants, along with various fruit trees. She uses potassium supplements to fertilize her crops and plants them in a staggered manner, allowing her to obtain monthly harvests and income.

Carmencita lives with her husband and three adult children in a house that they built with their savings more than 15 years ago. Her children are all independent adults and support their mother in her daily activities constantly.

To improve her yield and make it more sustainable, Carmencita has applied for a loan of $2,296,626 COP. This loan will allow her to purchase organic fertilizers that will improve the hydration process of her crops.

Carmencita is committed to providing the best quality crops and ensuring the sustainability of her land for her familyâ€™s future generations.
